line_2: I see all Europe's children curst

line_1: Starve in the harvest, in the vintage thirst!
line_2: See industry, by draining impost curst,

line_1: Bath'd in untasted springs we die with thirst;
line_2: If in possession of our wishes curs'd,

line_1: Famish'd for Food, Parch'd up with Heat and Thirst:
line_2: Fainted with wandring o'er the fiery Dust,
Lip-deep in what he longs for, and yet curst

line_1: Who, warm'd with genuine glory's honest thirst,
line_2: Divinely labour'd in the Pythian dust.

line_1: Pleading no right but merely that of thirst,
line_2: May largely drink, e'en till their bowels burst,

line_1: In mutual labour and in mutual thirst;
line_2: Partakes our cheerful meals, partaking first

line_1: In vain your Hunger's cur'd, and Thirst;
line_2: If you'd oblige her, you must burst.
